revised_title: Effects of Ovarian Steroids on Hypothalamic Neurons and LH Secretion in Diencephalic Island Preparations
tldr: The study investigates the effects of ovarian steroids, such as estrogen and progesterone, on the electrical activity of hypothalamic neurons and luteinizing hormone (LH) secretion in ovariectomized rats with diencephalic islands. The results show that the steroid-stimulated LH surge is significantly correlated with the increase in the electrical activity of preoptic and anterior hypothalamic neurons. This research provides insights into the mechanism of ovarian steroid action on the neuroendocrine control of LH secretion.
